author: Nigel Slater
programme: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
method: Whisk the eggs in a bowl and season well. Tear the thyme and basil leaves and add to the egg. Melt the butter in a non-stick pan. Add the spinach and cook for about one minute until the leaves soften. Add the spinach to the bowl with the eggs. Place a thin slice of butter in the pan. When it starts to sizzle add the eggs. Add the sliced goats’ cheese and rosemary and cook on a low to moderate heat. Preheat the grill on a high setting. After six minutes of frying, finish under the grill until golden on top and serve.
ingredients: 4 free-range eggs,  1 tbsp fresh thyme,  few basil leaves,  50g/1¾oz butter, plus extra for frying,  100g/3½oz spinach (a large handful) ,  150g/5½oz goats’ cheese, sliced,  1 tsp chopped rosemary
